meanings.definition: To give a particular job or piece of work to someone
meanings.sent1: The teacher is assigning homework to the students.
meanings.sent2: She is assigning tasks to her team members.
meanings.sent3: The robot started assigning random tasks to the humans, causing chaos.
meanings.sent4: The universe seems to be assigning me more work every day.
meanings.sent5: By assigning roles in the play, everyone knew what they had to do.

meanings.definition: To allocate or designate something for a specific purpose
meanings.sent1: The manager is assigning funds for the new project.
meanings.sent2: They are assigning seats for the event based on RSVPs.
meanings.sent3: The magician was assigning magical powers to everyday objects.
meanings.sent4: The chef was assigning flavors to each ingredient in the recipe.
meanings.sent5: By assigning colors to different sections, the map became easier to read.

meanings.definition: To transfer legal rights or responsibilities to someone else
meanings.sent1: The lawyer is assigning the contract to his colleague.
meanings.sent2: They are assigning ownership of the property to the new owner.
meanings.sent3: The cat was assigning its nap time duties to the dog.
meanings.sent4: The captain was assigning control of the ship to the first mate.
meanings.sent5: By assigning guardianship to the aunt, the child was in good hands.
